In Stage 2, instead of setting equal prices for both items, observe the buyer's initial choice and set a higher price for that item. For example, if the buyer chooses the apple, set the apple price at 6 and the orange price at 4. This increases the likelihood of the buyer switching to the orange in Stage 3, maximizing your utility by receiving a higher payment.
